data.title: Great Burgers
data.text: Nations is always consistent.  Great burgers, the best fries I know of (think a fatter and tastier version of McDonalds), and friendly service.  It does take a bit of time to get your food, so be patient.  The dining area is very clean.  I didn't have any pie on this trip, but in general, the chocolate cream pie is to die for.

data.title: Always a great burger and shake, but...
data.text: I love their burgers and shakes but the panhandlers and homeless roaming the strip mall do take away from the food experience.  Sometimes they come into the shop and ask for money while you are trying to eat.  Like all Nation's, your food is made to order, so service can be a bit slow if there is a line.

data.title: Easter dinner
data.text: I had to pick up something late because the bbq ended sooner. I went to pick some burgers and Crystal got my order. She was very nice and made sure the order was right. The place was busy for a holiday but she got order right. I will be back

data.title: Crystal was Awesome
data.text: We ordered a few burgers while we waited for a family member and the burgers were good. Crystal really helped with getting the order as I requested. She explained all the options and convince me to get a milkshake....which was awesome. I will return to this place because of the service but someone should recognize Crystal since she was really awesome.

data.title: Nuthin' Fancy, Just GOOD
data.text: Great hamburgers, homemade PIES, and some locations serve a huge breakfast!  Fast, friendly service.  And you can find a Nation's Burgers in almost every town in the East Bay.

data.title: Great Pies
data.text: If you don't bake or you need a dessert to take to a dinner party, this is the best place for pies!  You might call ahead and order the pie to make sure they have the type of pie you want.  The burgers are good...but messy.

data.title: The chain is not keeping pace and shrinking its food too...
data.text: There is too much comparing the chain in the 80s and now except the food is smaller. The taste hasn't really changed much. Its good, but nothing to write home about. The decor is the same as it was 30 years ago. The wait staff is impatient and inconsistent. There are many other chains that have sprung up and surpassed Nations and either they don't care or they are oblivious to what is going on around them. There are at least two other chain burger places in Tracy alone and numerous mom and pop burger places that are better. There are several other chains in existence that are better and would do better in Tracy. Have also been to San Leandro and Pleasanton Nations... Apparently it is a chain issue. Fix the decor. Get out of the 80s and give the original food sizes and stay up with the Jones...
